title: HTML — The Web Language
subtitle: From basics to modern technologies
intro_text: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard markup language for creating web pages. It defines the structure and content of a document displayed in a browser. HTML works alongside CSS (for styling) and JavaScript (for interactivity), forming the foundation of the modern web.
history_text: HTML was created in 1991 by British scientist Tim Berners-Lee at CERN. The first version had only 18 tags. Today, HTML5 is a powerful standard supporting multimedia, semantics, and APIs.
usage_text: HTML5 is used for: websites, mobile apps (PWA), <canvas> games, interactive forms, video/audio players, and even VR/AR content via WebXR.
facts: HTML is not a programming language but a markup language
The <!DOCTYPE> tag appeared only in HTML 4.01
HTML5 supports native video without Flash
